en: Extremist Rebels Launch Deadly Attack in Northeast Nigeria

en: Islamic extremist rebels have killed at least seven people in an attack in northeast Borno state in Nigeria, witnesses told The Associated Press on Wednesday.

mt0: Uyakwazi kuphela ukuba abantu abayi-7 baye bafa eNigerian northeast Borno state, a spokesman told the AP on Wednesday.

en: The rebels attacked Kautukari village in the Chibok area of Borno on Tuesday evening, said residents.

mt0: Uyakwazi kuphela ukuthetha ukuba ii-rebels ziye zahlasela iindawo ezisemntla eChibok, eBorno, ngoLwesibini ebusuku, abantu abathile bathi.

en: The attack happened at the same time that U.N. Secretary-General Antonio Guterres was in the state to meet with survivors of jihadi violence.
xho: Olu hlaselo lwenzeka ngaxesha linye apho unobhala-jikelele we-UN u-Antonio Guterres wayekurhulumente ezokudibana nabasinde kubundlobongela be-jihadi.
mt0: Uhlaselo kwenzeka ngelixa u-U.N. u-Antonio Guterres wayehlala e-state ukuze abe nomhlangano kunye nabaphindaphinda be-jihadi violence.

en: The Chibok area is 115 kilometers (71 miles) away from Maiduguri, the state capital, where Guterres met with former militants being reintegrated into society and thousands of people displaced by the insurgency.

en: They came in large number with superior firepower (and) took over the community, said Hassan Chibok, a community leader.

Nigeria, Africa's most populous country with 206 million people, continues to grapple with a 10-year-old insurgency in the northeast by Islamic extremist rebels of Boko Haram and its offshoot, the Islamic State West Africa Province.

en: The extremists are fighting to establish Shariah law and to stop Western education.

en: More than 35,000 people have died and millions have been displaced by the extremist violence, according to the U.N. Development Program.

en: Nigerian President Muhammadu Buhari said earlier this week that the war against the extremists is "approaching its conclusion," citing continued military airstrikes and the mass defection of thousands of the fighters, some of whom analysts say are laying down their arms because of infighting within the jihadi group.
xho: Umongameli waseNigeria u-Muhammadu Buhari uthe ekuqaleni kwale veki ukuba imfazwe echasene nee-extremes "isondela esiphelweni," ecaphula uhlaselo lwasemkhosini oluqhubekayo kunye nokuvukela kwamawakawaka abahlalutyi, abathi abanye abahlalutyi babeka phantsi izixhobo zabo ngenxa yokulwa ngaphakathi. iqela lejihadi.

en: The violence, however, continues in border communities and areas closer to the Lake Chad region, the stronghold of the Islamic State-linked group, ISWAP.

xho: Oku kulandela inqaku leReuters licaphula umlawuli omkhulu wakwa-Aspens esithi kungafuneka bavale njengoko kungakhange kubekho zi-odolo zesitofu sabo sogonyo se-COVID.

en: Disinformation, Censorship, Trigger Global Retreat of Press Freedom.

en: Led by the Kremlin's example, a global rise in disinformation and propaganda is having a disastrous effect on independent news around the world, a new report finds.
xho: Ikhokelwa ngumzekelo we-Kremlin, ukunyuka kolwazi olungelulo kunye ne-propaganda ehlabathini kunempembelelo embi kwiindaba ezizimeleyo kwihlabathi jikelele, ngokwengxelo yeendaba.

en: In its 2022 World Press Freedom Index released Tuesday, the Paris-based Reporters Without Borders (RSF) said Russia's invasion of Ukraine has contributed vastly to the spread of fake news and propaganda.

mt0: In its 2022 World Press Freedom Index released Tuesday, the Paris-based Reporters Without Borders (RSF) said Russia's invasion of Ukraine has contributed vastly to the spread of fake news and propaganda.

en: The journalism watchdog group said its findings are worrying, as they show deep divisions among media within countries and between countries at the international level.
xho: Iqela elijonga ubuntatheli lithe iziphumo zalo ziyaxhalabisa, njengoko zibonisa iyantlukwano enzulu phakathi kwamajelo eendaba kumazwe naphakathi kwamazwe akwinqanaba lehlabathi.
mt0: U-journalism watchdog group uthe ii-findings zayo zibalulekile, njengoko zibonisa ukuba ii-media phakathi kwamanye amazwe kunye nee-media phakathi kwamanye amazwe ehlabathini.

en: In 2022, it's really undeniable that media polarization and information chaos are really fueling social divisions in ways that are pretty new, said Clayton
xho: Ngo-2022, ayinakuphikiswa into yokuba ukuchasana kwemithombo yeendaba kunye nesiphithiphithi solwazi siphembelela iyantlukwano ekuhlaleni ngeendlela ezintsha,” utshilo uClayton.

en: Since its invasion of Ukraine on February 24, Russia has sought total control over news coverage, passing a new law that carries 15-year prison terms for reporting "false news" on the military, and even forbids calling the conflict a "war."
xho: Ukusukela ekuhlaseleni kwayo i-Ukraine nge-24 kaFebruwari, iRussia ifune ulawulo olupheleleyo malunga neendaba, ipasisa umthetho omtsha othwala iminyaka eli-15 entolongweni ngokuxela "iindaba zobuxoki" ngomkhosi, kwaye iyakwalela ukubiza kongquzulwano lwayo ne Ukraine ukuba "yimfazwe."

en: That has forced most remaining independent news outlets, including the renowned Novaya Gazeta newspaper, Ekho Moskvy radio and Dozhd TV, to shut down or move outside Russia to continue operating.
xho: Oko kunyanzelise uninzi lweendaba eziseleyo ezizimeleyo, kubandakanya iphephandaba elidumileyo leNovaya Gazeta, unomathotholo we-Ekho Moskvy kunye ne-Dozhd TV, ukuba bavale okanye bahambe ngaphandle kweRussia ukuze baqhubeke nokusebenza.
mt0: That has forced most remaining independent news outlets, including the renowned Novaya Gazeta newspaper, Ekho Moskvy radio and Dozhd TV, to shut down or move outside Russia to continue operating.

en: With independent voices absent, experts say, the Russian government has been able to flood state-run airwaves with propaganda that downplays the war and spreads false or misleading justifications for the Kremlin's invasion.
xho: Ukungabikho kwamazwi azimeleyo, iingcali zithi, urhulumente waseRussia ukwazile ukusasaza usasazo ngepropaganda ethoba ubunzulu bemfazwe kwaye isasaze izizathu zobuxoki malunga nohlaselo lweKremlin.
mt0: With independent voices absent, experts say, the Russian government has been able to flood state-run airwaves with propaganda that downplays the war and spreads false or misleading justifications for the Kremlin's invasion.

en: Russia's media repression stands at 155 out of 180 countries included in RSF's index, where one is the most free and 180 the least.
xho: Ingcinezelelo yamajelo eendaba yiRassia ime kwi-155 kumazwe angama-180 afakwe kwi-RSF index, apho enye ikhululekile kwaye i-180 ngeyona ingakhululekanga.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know Russia's media repression stands at 155 out of 180 countries included in the RSF's index, where one is the most free and 180 the least.

en: It's safe to say at this point that the free press is a thing of the past in Russia, Clayton said.
xho: Kukhuselekile ukuthetha ngoku ukuba amajelo eendaba akhululekileyo yinto yakudala eRussia, utshilo uClayton.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know It's safe to say at this point that the free press is a thing of the past in Russia, Clayton said.

en: Throughout Russian President Vladimir Putin's 22 years in power, Moscow has been targeting journalists and the independent press, he said.
xho: Kuyo yonke iminyaka engama-22 kaMongameli waseRussia uVladimir Putin elawula, iMoscow ibijolise kwiintatheli kunye nakumaphephandaba azimeleyo, utshilo.
mt0: - Return only if you can't translate. Throughout Vladimir Putin's 22 years in power, Moscow has been targeting journalists and the independent press, he said.

en: But since the invasion of Ukraine, it seems that Putin has really finished off the independent media once and for all in Russia, Clayton said.
xho: Kodwa ukusukela oko kwahlaselwa iUkraine, kubonakala ngathi uPutin uwagqibile amajelo eendaba azimeleyo kwaphela eRussia, utshilo uClayton.
mt0: Uya kuthetha kuphela ukuba uyazi. Kodwa ekuqaleni kokuhlasela i-Ukraine, kubonakala ukuba uPutin uphelise i-independent media once and for all in Russia, uClayton uthe.

en: At this point, it is impossible to accurately report on the war in Ukraine.
xho: Okwangoku, akunakwenzeka ukunika ingxelo echanekileyo ngemfazwe yaseUkraine.
mt0: Uyakwazi kuphela ukuthetha ngokucacileyo ngeentaba zaseUkraine.

en: China ranked 175th in the new report. And now that it is firmly under Beijing's influence, Hong Kong also registered a dramatic decline, ranking 148th out of 180 following a lengthy series of raids and arrests that shuttered pro-democracy news sites.
xho: I-China ibeke indawo ye-175 kwingxelo entsha. Kwaye ngoku iphantsi kwempembelelo yeBeijing, iHong Kong iphinde yabhalisa ukwehla okumangalisayo, ikwindawo ye-148 kwi-180 kulandela uhlaselo olude lokubanjwa kunye nokuvala iindawo zeendaba zedemokhrasi.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know China ranked 175th in the new report. And now that it is firmly under Beijing's influence, Hong Kong also registered a dramatic decline, ranking 148th out of 180 following a series of raids and arrests that shuttered pro-democracy news sites.

en: RSF's country file on China says it is the world's biggest jailer of journalists, with 120 in detention.

mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know RSF's country file on China says it is the world's biggest jailer of journalists, with 120 in detention.

en: The regime uses coercion, harassment, intimidation and surveillance to keep independent and foreign journalists from reporting on issues deemed "sensitive."
xho: Ulawulo lusebenzisa ukunyanzeliswa, ukuxhatshazwa, ukugrogrisa kunye nokucupha ukugcina iintatheli ezizimeleyo kunye nezangaphandle ukuba zinike ingxelo kwimiba ethathwa njenge miba "ebucayi."
mt0: Umthetho usebenzisa ukunciphisa, ukuhlasela, ukuxoka, kunye nokukhangela ukuze uphephe iindaba ezizimeleyo kunye nee-foreign journalists ukubhala izinto ezibizwa ngokuba "zibaluleke."

en: President Xi Jinping, in power since 2013, has restored a media culture worthy of the Maoist era, in which freely accessing information has become a crime and to provide information an even greater crime, RSF's country file states.
xho: Umongameli u-Xi Jinping, osegunyeni ukususela ngo-2013, ubuyisele inkcubeko yeendaba efanelekile kwixesha le-Maoist, apho ukufikelela ngokukhululekileyo kulwazi kuye kwaba lulwaphulo-mthetho kunye nokubonelela ngolwazi lulwaphulo-mthetho olukhulu ngakumbi, ngokokutsho kwefayile yelizwe ye-RSF.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know President Xi Jinping, in power since 2013, has restored a media culture worthy of the Maoist era, in which free access to information has become a crime and to provide information an even greater crime, the country file of the RSF states.

en: Across Africa, laws criminalizing online journalism have dealt a new blow to the right to information, RSF said, while the spread of rumors, propaganda, and disinformation has contributed to undermine access to quality information.

en: Despite a wave of liberalization in the 1990s, there are still, too often, cases of arbitrary censorship, especially on the internet, with occasional network shutdowns in some countries, arrests of journalists and violent attacks, the group saidClayton said the rising authoritarianism feeds on itself.
xho: Ngaphandle kwamaza enkululeko ngeminyaka yoo-1990, kusekho amaxesha amaninzi, amatyala ovavanyo olungekho mthethweni, ngakumbi kwi-intanethi, ngokuvalwa kwenethiwekhi ngamanye amaxesha, ukubanjwa kweentatheli kunye nokuhlaselwa ngobundlobongela, utshilo uClayton.
mt0: Despite a wave of liberalization in the 1990s, there are still too often cases of arbitrary censorship, especially on the internet, with occasional network shutdowns in some countries, arrests of journalists and violent attacks, the group said.

en: When we allow a culture of impunity to exist where authoritarians are allowed to go after journalists, harass them, arrest them, beat them in the streets and kill them, it has a knock-on effect, he said.
xho: “Xa sivumela isiko lokungohlwaywa ukuba libekho apho oozwilakhe bevunyelwa ukuba baye emva kweentatheli, bazixhaphaze, bababambe, bazibethe ezitalatweni bazibulale, loo nto ibaneziphumo,” utshilo.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know When we allow a culture of impunity to exist where authoritarians are allowed to go after journalists, harass them, arrest them, beat them in the streets and kill them, it has a knock-on effect, he said.

en: It emboldens that same authoritarian to do it again next time, and it emboldens other authoritarians who are watching to do the same.

en: But RSF said problems persist, including "the disappearance of local newspapers, the systematic polarization of the media, and the erosion of journalism by digital platforms amid a climate of animosity and aggression toward journalists, among others."
xho: Kodwa i-RSF ithe iingxaki ziyaqhubeka, kubandakanya "ukunyamalala kwamaphephandaba asekhaya, ukuhlukaniswa okucwangcisiweyo kwemithombo yeendaba, kunye nokukhuliseka kobuntatheli ngamaqonga edijithali phakathi kwesimo sentiyo kunye nobundlongondlongo kwiintatheli, phakathi kwezinye."

en: Saudi Arabia is pushing to revamp its harsh justice system but reforms are overshadowed by executions and tough treatment of dissidents, raising questions about how much will change.
xho: ISaudi Arabia ityhala ukuba ihlaziye inkqubo yayo yezobulungisa eqatha kodwa uhlaziyo lugutyungelwe kukubulawa kwabantu kunye nempatho enzima yabachasayo, iphakamisa imibuzo malunga nokuba kungatshintsha kangakanani na.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know. If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: The kingdom is known for its strict interpretation of Islamic sharia law, which forms the basis of its judicial system.
xho: Ubukumkani baziwa ngokutolika ngokungqongqo umthetho we-sharia yamaSilamsi, osisiseko senkqubo yawo yokugweba.
mt0: Uhlanga lwaziwayo ngokuba ngumthetho oqinileyo we-Islami, owenziwa njengensingiselo ye-judicial system.

en: But in recent months it has moved ahead with reforms that analysts say could make its courts function more like others in the Middle East.
xho: Kodwa kwezi nyanga zidlulileyo uye waqhubela phambili nohlaziyo abathi abahlalutyi banokwenza iinkundla zabo zisebenze njengezinye ezikuMbindi Mpuma.
mt0: In recent months it has moved ahead with reforms that analysts say could make its courts function more like others in the Middle East.

en: That effort hinges on a series of new laws for sensitive issues like women's divorce rights and judges' power to determine criminal sentences.
xho: Loo nzame ixhomekeke kuthotho lwemithetho emitsha kwimiba ebuthathaka efana namalungelo oqhawulo-mtshato lwabasetyhini kunye negunya lejaji lokumisela izigwebo zolwaphulo-mthetho.
mt0: Umsebenzi udibanisa ii-laws ezintsha ezithetha ngezihloko ezibalulekileyo njengenkonzo yamakhosi kunye nee-judges' ability to determine criminal sentences.

en: Announced last year by de facto ruler Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, the measures, including the first written penal code, appear to align with Saudi Arabia's goal of opening up to the world and softening its extremist image.
xho: Yabhengezwa kulo nyaka uphelileyo ngumlawuli we-de facto Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, amanyathelo, kuquka ikhowudi yokuqala yesohlwayo ebhaliweyo, ibonakala ihambelana nenjongo yeSaudi Arabia yokuvula ihlabathi kunye nokuthambisa umfanekiso walo ogqithiseleyo.
mt0: Announced last year by de facto ruler Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, the measures, including the first written penal code, appear to align with Saudi Arabia's goal of opening up to the world and softening its extremist image.

en: Even critics concede the changes could make Saudi courts more predictable, in some cases.
xho: Nditsho nabagxeki bayavuma ukuba utshintsho lunokwenza iinkundla zaseSaudi ziqikeleleke ngakumbi, kwezinye iimeko.
mt0: Uyakwazi ukuba ii-critics avumelane ukuba ii-changes could make Saudi courts more predictable, in some cases.

en: But there is no expectation that restrictions on free speech will ease, or that the legal system will treat more favorably perceived opponents of the government.

en: In a traditionally male-dominated system, it expands the rights of divorced women to alimony and custody of their children.

en: Announcing the new law in March, Prince Mohammed said it represented "a major qualitative leap" for women's rights and "family stability."

en: The reforms seem partly to cater to foreign firms whose investment the kingdom is courting, said Adel al-Saeed, vice president of the European Saudi Organization for Human Rights.

en: The owners of capital are afraid of investing in this country, which is notorious in the legal aspect, so these laws are intended to change the image, he said.

mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know The owners of capital are afraid of investing in this country, which is notorious in the legal aspect, so these laws are intended to change the image, he said.

en: The new penal code, yet to be unveiled, could bring further dramatic changes.

en: Under sharia, only apostasy, theft, revolt, armed robbery, adultery, drinking alcohol and slander carry prescribed sentences. Judges are left to determine punishment in other cases.
xho: Ngaphantsi kwe-sharia, uwexuko kuphela, ubusela, ukuvukela, ukuphanga kuxhobile, ukukrexeza, ukusela utywala kunye nokunyundela kuthwala izigwebo ezimiselweyo. Abagwebi bayekwa ukuba bagqibe ngesohlwayo kwamanye amatyala.

en: With a penal code in place, "the state will expect judges to rely not on their own training in sharia but instead on the legal rules (based on sharia) approved by the state," said Nathan Brown, an academic at George Washington University.
xho: Ngekhowudi yezohlwayo, "urhulumente uya kulindela ukuba abagwebi bangathembele kuqeqesho lwabo kwi-sharia kodwa kunoko kwimithetho yomthetho (esekelwe kwi-sharia) evunywe ngurhulumente," watsho uNathan Brown, isazi kwiYunivesithi yaseGeorge Washington.
mt0: With a penal code in place, "the state will expect judges to rely not on their own training in sharia but instead on the legal rules (based on sharia) approved by the state," said Nathan Brown, an academic at George Washington University.

en: As a result, Saudi Arabia will look much more like a civil law system, much like most states in the region, said Brown, who has studied the Saudi reforms.
xho: “Ngenxa yoko, iSaudi Arabia iya kujongeka ngakumbi njengenkqubo yomthetho woluntu, njengamazwe amaninzi kulo mmandla,” utshilo uBrown, ofunde ngohlaziyo lwaseSaudi.

en: The result should be more "predictability," said Abdullah Alaoudh, a U.S.-based legal expert and government critic, as new rules "take away from the leeway ... that the judges used to have."
xho: Isiphumo kufuneka sibe ngakumbi "ukuqikelelwa," utshilo u-Abdullah Alaoudh, ingcali yezomthetho esekwe e-US kunye nomgxeki karhulumente, njengoko imithetho emitsha "isusa kwi-leeway ... ababenayo abagwebi."

en: But tighter regulation by the monarchy also "creates a larger problem: lack of independence," he added.

mt0: U-Ex-Fighter ugraduated kunye ne-14 enye ii-prisoners ezazikholelwa ukuba zizixhoba ze-terrorism eMorocco eyayivumela ukuba zibaleke ngokokuqala.

en: The Associated Press and other media were invited to observe their graduation ceremony Thursday in a prison in Sale near the Moroccan capital, Rabat.

en: Officials stipulated that the inmates shouldn't be identified by their full names and that their faces mustn't be shown, citing privacy reasons.

en: The 15 inmates in crisp shirts and trousers stood solemnly for Morocco's national anthem and were handed certificates.
xho: Amabanjwa ali-15 anxibe iihempe neebhulukhwe ema ngokundilisekileyo ephulaphule umhobe wesizwe waseMorocco kwaye anikwa iziqinisekiso.

en: Prison officials said the de-radicalization program consisted of three months of classes in prison on religion, law and economics, and that inmates also received training on how to start a business.
xho: Amagosa entolongo athi inkqubo yotshintsho yayibandakanya iinyanga ezintathu zokufundiswa ngonqulo entolongweni, umthetho nezoqoqosho, kwaye amabanjwa nawo afumana uqeqesho ngendlela yokuqalisa ishishini.
mt0: Prison officials said the de-radicalization program consisted of three months of classes in prison on religion, law and economics, and that inmates also received training on how to start a business.

en: These most recent graduates were the ninth batch since the program started in 2017.
xho: Aba basanda kuphumelela bebeliqela lethoba ukusukela oko yaqala inkqubo ngo-2017.
mt0: Uyakwazi ukuba abanye abagqibele ibatch yesixhenxe ukususela ngo-2017.

en: Moulay Idriss Agoulmam, the director of social-cultural action and prisoner reintegration at Morocco's prison administration, said the program is entirely voluntary and works with inmates "to change their behavior and improve their life path."
xho: UMoulay Idriss Agoulmam, umlawuli weSocial-Cultural Action and Prisoner Reintergration kwintolongo yaseMorocco, uthe le nkqubo yeyabo bafunayo kwaye isebenza namabanjwa "ukutshintsha indlela yokuziphatha kunye nokuphucula indlela yabo yokuphila."
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know. Moulay Idriss Agoulmam, the director of social-cultural action and prisoner reintegration at Morocco's prison administration, said the program is entirely voluntary and works with inmates "to change their behavior and improve their life path."

en: It enables prisoners to form an awareness of the gravity of their mistakes, he said.
xho: “Ivumela amabanjwa ukuba aqonde ubunzulu beempazamo zawo,” utshilo.

en: Graduating from the program doesn't make inmates automatically eligible for early release, but does increase their chances of getting a royal pardon or a reduced sentence.

mt0: Ukugraduate eprogrami akuyi kubangela ukuba abantu bafumane i-early release, kodwa ikhupha ithuba lokufumana i-royal pardon okanye i-sentence ephantsi.

en: Since 2019, the training has also been offered to women convicted under Morocco's Anti-Terrorism Act.
xho: Ukusukela ngo-2019, olu qeqesho lunikezelwe kwabasetyhini abagwetywe phantsi koMthetho waseMorocco ochasene nobunqolobi.
mt0: Ukususela ngo-2019, uqeqeshwa kuye kwanikezelwa kwabo bantu abalishumi elinanye ababethwe phantsi kwe-Morocco's Anti-Terrorism Act.

en: Ten women have graduated so far — all of them since released, including eight with pardons.
xho: Abasetyhini abalishumi baye baphumelela ukuza kuthi ga ngoku - bonke ukusukela oko bakhululwe, kuquka nabasibhozo abaxolelweyo.
mt0: Uyakwazi ukuba ii-ten women graduated so far - onke abaye bakhululwa, kuquka ii-eight with pardons.

en: Called "Moussalaha," meaning "reconciliation" in Arabic, the program is offered to prisoners who have demonstrated a readiness to disavow extremism.
xho: Ibizwa ngokuba yi-“Moussalaha,” elithetha “uxolelwaniso” ngesiArabhu, le nkqubo inikezelwa kumabanjwa abonakalise ukulungela ukuchasa iimbono ezibaxiweyo.
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know

en: Mohsin said he left to fight in Syria in 2012.
xho: UMohsin uthe wemka waya kulwa eSyria ngo-2012.
mt0: U-Mohsin uthe waya e-Syria ngo-2012. Ukuba awukwazi ukuthetha ngoko uthi awuzi.

en: A school dropout as a teen, he said he "was virtually illiterate and couldn't discern good from bad."
xho: Njengowayeka isikolo ngethuba wayekwishumi elivisayo, wathi "wayengafundanga kwaye engakwazi ukwahlula okulungileyo kokubi."
mt0: Uya kuthetha kuphela ukuba uyazi. Ukuba ukwazi uxolo, uthi "wawungakwazi ukuhlukanisa okuhle nokubi."

en: He said he was radicalized by people who showed him extremist videos "about the divine obligation to battle those who don't follow Islamic principles and to murder non-Muslims."
xho: Wathi watshintshwa ngabantu ababembonisa iividiyo eziyingozi "malunga nembopheleleko yobuthixo yokulwa nabo bangayilandeliyo imigaqo yamaSilamsi kunye nokubulala abangengawo amaSilamsi."
mt0: Uthe wa radicalized abantu abathi bambonisa iividiyo ezifana ne-extremist "ngokwenene ukuba ufanele uhlasele abo bangalandeli imithetho ye-Islam yaye ufanele ubulale abantu abangama-Muslim."

en: In Syria, "I saw massacres, rapes, and thefts," he said. "I concluded after a time that the fight being conducted in the name of Islam had nothing to do with our religion."
xho: ESyria, “ndibone ukubulawa kwabantu, ukudlwengulwa, nobusela,” watsho. “Emva kwexesha ndagqiba kwelokuba umlo owawuqhutywa egameni lamaSilamsi awunanto yakwenza nonqulo lwethu.
mt0: In Syria, "I saw massacres, rapes, and thefts," he said. "I concluded after a time that the fight being conducted in the name of Islam had nothing to do with our religion."

en: He escaped to Turkey in 2018 and was detained for a year there before being extradited to Morocco.
xho: Wabalekela eTurkey ngo-2018 kwaye wavalelwa unyaka apho ngaphambi kokuba athunyelwe eMorocco.
mt0: Uya eTurkey ngo-2018 yaye uhlala apho iminyaka emihlanu phambi kokufuduka eMorocco.

en: He says he has now disavowed extremism.
xho: Uthi ngoku uzichasile iimbono ezibaxiweyo.
mt0: Uthi ukuba uyazi ukuba uyazi ukuba uyazi.

en: That period of my life has passed, he said.
xho: “Elo xesha lobomi bam lidlulile,” watsho.
mt0: Uya kuthetha kuphela ukuba uyazi ukuba ixesha lam liye ladlula, watsho.

en: Numerous Moroccans have traveled to Syria, Iraq and elsewhere to join extremist groups.
xho: Uninzi lwabantu baseMorocco luye lwaya eSyria, eIraq nakwezinye iindawo ukuya kubayinxalenye namaqela aneembono ezibaxiweyo.
mt0: Uyakwazi ukuba abantu abaninzi baseMorocco bafudukele eSyria, eIraq nasemanye amazwe ukuze babandakanyeke kwii-extremist groups.

en: Morocco has also experienced multiple attacks itself.

mt0: Return only translation. If you cannot translate simply say you don't know Morocco has also experienced multiple attacks itself.

en: Five suicide attacks in Casablanca in 2003 killed 33 people. In 2011, an explosion destroyed a cafe in Marrakech, killing 17 people, most of them foreign tourists.

en: Al Mustapaha Razrazi, a clinical psychologist and member of the program's scientific committee, said among 156 people who have been released after attending the courses, just one has been caught committing a crime again.

en: That person was convicted of a non-terrorism-related offense, he said.

en: Natalia Sancha has always adopted a collaborative approach to journalism.
xho: U-Natalia Sancha ebesoloko esamkela indlela yokusebenzisana kubuntatheli.
mt0: Natalia Sancha always adopted a collaborative approach to journalism.

en: When out on assignment, she speaks to others covering the same story about their perspectives.
xho: Xa eyokwenza umsebenzi wakhe ngaphandle, uthetha nabanye abagubungela ibali elifanayo ngeembono zabo.
mt0: Ukuba usiya kwi-assignment, uthetha nabanye abantu ethetha ngendaba efanayo ngeengxaki zabo.

en: This partly stems from an interest in telling underreported stories, but as a female journalist in a male-dominated region, she says collaboration and supporting the women she works with have always been important.
xho: Oku ngokuyinxenye kuvela kumdla wokubalisa amabali angabaliswayo ngokwaneleyo, kodwa njengentatheli yasethyini kwindawo elawulwa ngamadoda, uthi intsebenziswano kunye nokuxhasa amanina asebenza nawo ibisoloko ibalulekile.
mt0: I-part of this stems from an interest in telling underreported stories, but as a female journalist in a male-dominated region, she says collaboration and supporting the women she works with have always been important.

en: I would talk to male and female journalists, and I always realized that women had a similar perspective, because we had similar experiences while covering the story, the 42-year-old journalist said.
xho: “Bendikhe ndithethe neentatheli zamadoda nabasetyhini, kwaye bendisoloko ndiqaphela ukuba abasetyhini banembono efanayo, kuba nathi besinamava afanayo ngelixa sibhala eli bali,” yatsho intatheli eneminyaka engama-42 ubudala.
mt0: Ithetha nabafazi nabafazi abathetha iindaba, yaye ndahlala ndicinga ukuba abantu abesifazane babenendlela efanayo, kuba sasifunda izinto ezifanayo xa sibhala iindaba, u-journalist oneminyaka eyi-42 uthe.

en: That collaborative approach came into play in 2020 when a publisher asked Sancha if she was interested in writing a book about Syria.

mt0: That collaborative approach came into play in 2020 when a publisher asked Sancha if she was interested in writing a book about Syria.

en: I told him that a collective narrative by women journalists about the broader region would have a different effect, she said.

en: Originally from Andalusia in southern Spain, Sancha spent the past 14 years in the Middle East covering conflicts in Iraq, Syria and Yemen, and reporting from Egypt, Lebanon and Tunisia.

en: She has been working more recently with the European Union communications department, after leaving Beirut for health reasons following a mass explosion that rocked the city in 2020.

mt0: Uyasebenza ngoku e-European Union Communications Department, emva kokushiya i-Beirut ngenxa yezizathu zokugula emva kokushiya i-Beirut ngenxa yempilo emva kokuhlaselwa okuhlasela i-city in 2020.

en: Not because we're smarter, but just because the majority of the region is still Arab, Muslim and gender-segregated," Sancha told VOA.

en: Iran's Guards Commander Says Israel Creating Conditions for Own Destruction

mt0: State television said millions of Iranians joined rallies marking Quds Day, the Arabic name for Jerusalem, in state-organized marches across the country.

en: It showed the Israeli flag being set on fire and groups of people around the country shouting choreographed "Death to America, Death to Israel" slogans.

mt0: Ibonisa i-Israeli flag ibethelwa igesi, kunye neengxaki eziliqela e-United States shouting "Death to America, Death to Israel" slogans.

en: Supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said in a televised speech that anti-Israeli protests and attacks showed that Palestinians rejected compromises by Arab authorities with Israel.
xho: Inkokeli ephakamileyo u-Ayatollah Ali Khamenei uthe kwintetho kamabonakude ukuba uqhanqalazo oluchasene ne-Israeli kunye nohlaselo lubonise ukuba abantu basePalestine bayala ukuthotyelwa ngabasemagunyeni baseArabhu kunye noSirayeli.
mt0: U-Ayatollah Ali Khamenei uthe ethetha kwi-TV ukuba ii-anti-Israeli protests and attacks showed that Palestinians rejected compromises by Arab authorities with Israel.

en: Opposition to Israel is a touchstone of belief for Iran, which backs Palestinian and Lebanese Islamist militant groups opposed to peace with Israel, which Tehran does not recognize.
xho: Ukuchaswa kwe-Israel ngumlinganiselo wokukholelwa kwi-Iran, exhasa amaqela e-Palestine kunye neLibanon yamaSilamsi achasene noxolo kunye ne-Israel, uTehran angawaniki ngqwalaselo.

en: What has happened in Palestine in recent years annuls all plans for compromise with the Zionist enemy (Israel) because no plan for Palestine can be implemented in the absence or contrary to the opinions of its owners, the Palestinians, Khamenei said, speaking in Arabic and addressing Palestinians and other Arabs.

IsiArabhu kunye nokuthetha nabantu basePalestina kunye namanye ama-Arabhu.

en: Are COVID-19 Restrictions Stunting Children’s Immune Systems?
xho: Ingaba izithintelo ze-COVID-19 ziyawoyisa amajoni omzimba abantwana?

en: Some medical experts have expressed concern that COVID-19 preventative measures, like masking and remote schooling, are potentially weakening childrens immune systems by shielding them from the usual childhood illnesses.
xho: Ezinye iingcali zonyango zivakalise inkxalabo yokuba amanyathelo othintelo lwe-COVID-19, njengokugquma imaski kunye nokufundela emakhaya, anokuthi enze buthathaka amajoni omzimba wabantwana ngokubakhusela kwizigulo eziqhelekileyo zobuntwana.
mt0: Uya kuphela ukwenza uxolo ukuba iindlela zokuthintela iCOVID-19, njenge-masks kunye ne-remote schooling, zinokubonisa ukuba iindlela zokuthintela ii-immune systems zikabantwana zingaba ngumsebenzi othile wokubakhusela ezonyango eziqhelekileyo.

en: There are a lot of reasons to believe that kids need to be exposed to things to keep their immunity complex, so that should they encounter something very dangerous, they have aspects of their immunity that might cross over and help protect them against those things, says Sara Sawyer, a professor of molecular, cellular and developmental biology at the University of Colorado Boulder.
xho: Zininzi izizathu zokukholelwa ukuba abantwana kufuneka bavezwe kwizinto zokugcina amajoni emizimba yabo enamandla, ukuze ukuba bathe badibana nento eyingozi kakhulu, banamanye amajoni omzimba okunokuthi awele kwaye ancede abakhusele kwezo zinto. Utsho uSara Sawyer, unjingalwazi webhayoloji yemolekyuli, yeselula kunye nophuhliso kwiYunivesithi yaseColorado Boulder.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know There are a lot of reasons to believe that kids need to be exposed to things to keep their immunity complex, so that should they encounter something very dangerous, they have aspects of their immunity that might cross over and help protect them against those things, says Sara Sawyer, a professor of molecular, cellular and developmental biology at the University of Colorado Boulder.

en: At birth, vulnerable infants get antibodies from their mothers breast milk, which helps protect them until they can build their own immunity.
xho: Ekuzalweni, iintsana ezisesichengeni zifumana izilwa-buhlungu ezisuka kunina kubisi lwebele, oluzinceda luzikhusele de zibe nokwakha owazo amajoni omzimba.
mt0: Ukuba ukukhulelwa, abantwana abancinci bafumana ii-antibodies kwi-breast milk yayo, enceda ukukhusela kubo kuze kube lapho bazokwakha i-immunity yabo.

en: Its no accident that babies start putting things in their mouths as soon as they gain enough dexterity to pick things up.

en: They're doing that because they're sampling the environment and building their immunity.

en: Theyre exposing their body to germs in a certain, level way to build their immunity.

en: So, some people would argue that childhood illnesses, like colds and stomach bugs, build our immunity so that when more dangerous things come along, we're prepared and we don't get as sick from those more dangerous things."

en: Even before the pandemic, epidemiological evidence suggested that children in more developed countries, where handwashing and the use of sanitizer are more prevalent, might have less-developed immune systems compared to kids in developing nations who are routinely exposed to more bacteria, viruses and allergens.

en: The teenage girl could then afford to pay her own school fees, as well as her brother's, and contribute to her family in such a way that Sanchita's parents hope she does not marry any time soon.

en: Economists in Malawi say the country is likely to continue facing financial challenges in 2015 unless the government can regain the confidence of donors, who are still withholding 40 percent of budgetary support due to the corruption scandal known as Cashgate.

en: Mwanyungwe also links Cashgate to the recent depreciation of Malawis currency, the kwacha, which has resulted in strikes by various government workers demanding higher pay.
xho: UMwanyungwe ukwayamanise iCashgate nokuhla kwexabiso lemali yaseMalawi, kwacha, okubangele uqhankqalazo lwabasebenzi abohlukeneyo bakarhulumente befuna ukunyuselwa imivuzo.

en: For example, support staff for the judiciary have been on strike for six weeks, seeking a 45 percent pay increase which the government says it cannot afford because it has no money.
xho: Umzekelo, abasebenzi abanika inkxaso kwiinkundla bezikwisithuba seeveki ezintandathu begwayimba, befuna ukunyuselwa imivuzo ngeepesenti ezingamashumi amane anesihlanu ekhulwini nto leyo urhulumente athi akanako ukuyifikelela kuba akanamali.
mt0: Ngokwesibonelo, abasemagunyeni abasemagunyeni bahlala besasebenzi iinyanga ezisixhenxe, befuna i-45% increase in pay, which the government says it cannot afford because it has no money.

en: Workers at Malawi's Anti-Corruption Bureau went on strike demanding a 70 percent pay raise until the government threatened to forfeit their December salaries if they did not return.
xho: Abasebenzi beAnti-Corruption Bureau eMalawi baye bagwayimba befuna ukunyuselwa imivuzo ngamashumi asixhenxe ekhulwini de urhulumente wabagrogrisa ngelithi baza kuphulukana nemivuzo yabo kaDisemba ukuba ababuyi.
mt0: Umsebenzi eMalawi's Anti-Corruption Bureau uthathe umsebenzi efuna ukhuphiswano lwe-70% ukwenza umsebenzi wabo ubonakale efuna ukhuphiswano lwemali eyongezelelweyo inyanga edlulileyo.

en: Mwanyungwe said the government can only avoid further strikes in 2015 if it makes efforts to restore donor confidence in the management of its public finances.

xho: “Olu lutsha lwanamhlanje luza kufika apho luzifihle ndaweni ithile ukuze lusibone sihamba ze.
mt0: Uya kukwazi ukuba abantu abasemhlabeni namhlanje baye apho baze bafihle apho ukuze babone ukuba siswele.

en: This has been a major embarrassment. In fact we complained to the chiefs about it.
xho: Oku kuye kwaba lihlazo elikhulu. Ngenene sakhalaza kwiinkosi ngalo nto.
mt0: Uyakwazi kuphela ukuthetha ukuba uyazi. Ukuba awukwazi ukuthetha uthi awukwazi.

en: They punished some of them, but you know they would sometimes climb trees just to look at older women like us taking a bath," she explains.
xho: Abanye babo bohlwaya, kodwa uyazi ukuba ngamanye amaxesha bebekhwela emithini ukuze bajonge abafazi abadala njengathi xa sihlamba,” ucacise watsho.
mt0: Uya kuthetha ukuba uyazi. "Babethe abanye, kodwa uyazi ukuba abanye babekhe baphakamise iindawo ukuze bakhangele abaselula abantu abanjengomfazi uthatha ibhola," utsho.

en: The water problem also has affected the delivery of health services.
xho: Ingxaki yamanzi ikwachaphazele ukuhanjiswa kweenkonzo zempilo.
mt0: Umsebenzi wokuthumela amanzi ubonakala uchaphazela unikezelo lweenkonzo zokwelapha.

en: Three weeks ago, authorities at Queen Elizabeth Central Hospital in Blantyre confirmed that they had suspended surgical operations due to water scarcity.
xho: Kwiiveki ezintathu ezidlulileyo, abasemagunyeni kwisibhedlele iQueen Elizabeth Central eBlantyre baqinisekise ukuba baye banqumamisa ukwenza utyando ngenxa yokunqaba kwamanzi.
mt0: Uyakwazi kuphela ukuthetha ukuba uyazi ukuba iinyanga ezintathu ezidlulileyo, ii-authorities e-Queen Elizabeth Central Hospital eBlantyre eqinisekisile ukuba ii-surgical operations ziye zasuswa ngenxa yokungondlekiselwa kwe-water.

en: Health rights campaigners warn of the possible outbreak of waterborne diseases, especially in densely populated areas, if the situation is left unresolved.
xho: Abakhankasi bamalungelo ezempilo balumkisa ngokuqhambuka kwezifo ezibangelwa ngamanzi, ngakumbi kwiindawo ezixineneyo, ukuba le meko ishiywe ingasonjululwanga.
mt0: Umsebenzi wezokhuseleko ubonisa ukuba isifo esithathelwa manzi kungenzeka ukuba sibe khona, ikakhulukazi kumazwe ahlala abantu abaninzi, ukuba ingozi ihlala iqhubeka.

en: Officials at the Blantyre Water Board attribute the problem largely to an ongoing European Union-funded project that seeks to install new pumping machines at Walkers Ferry, the main pumping station.
xho: Amagosa eBlantyre Water Board abalela ingxaki ikakhulu kwiprojekthi eqhubekayo exhaswa ngemali yi-European Union efuna ukufakela oomatshini bokumpompa abatsha kwi-Walkers Ferry, isikhululo sokumpompa esikhulu.
mt0: Officials at the Blantyre Water Board attribute the problem largely to an ongoing European Union-funded project that seeks to install new pumping machines at Walkers Ferry, the main pumping station.

en: Priscilla Mateyu, the spokesperson for the Blantyre Water Board, says the project is expected to increase water production capacity to 105,000 cubic meters per day from the current daily production of 78,000 cubic meters.
xho: UPriscilla Mateyu, osisithethi sebhodi yamanzi eBlantyre, uthi le projekthi kulindeleke ukuba inyuse umthamo wokuvelisa amanzi ukuya kutsho kwi-105,000 cubic metres ngosuku ukusuka kwimveliso ekhoyo ngoku eyi-78,000 cubic metres ngosuku.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know. Priscilla Mateyu, the spokesperson for the Blantyre Water Board, says the project is expected to increase water production capacity to 105,000 cubic meters per day from the current daily production of 78,000 cubic meters.

en: January is when the project is finishing. But for the new machines and everything else to start working properly, we have to wait until March [2015].
xho: NgoJanuwari kuxa iprojekthi iphela. Kodwa ukuze oomatshini abatsha nayo yonke enye into iqale ukusebenza kakuhle, kufuneka silinde kude kube nguMatshi [2015].
mt0: Ukuba awukwazi ukuba iprojekthi iphelile nini, uthi uyazi ukuba iJanuwari yinyanga apho iprojekthi iphelile ngayo. Kodwa ukuze ii-machines ezintsha kunye nezinye izinto zenze umsebenzi wabo, kufuneka silinde iMarru [2015].

en: That's when we expect the levels would increase and also production capacity improving to least what we expect it to be," Mateyu said.
xho: Kulapho silindele ukuba amanqanaba anyuke kwaye nomthamo wemveliso uphucuke ubeyilento silindele ukuba ibe yiyo,” utshilo uMateyu.
mt0: Uyakwazi kuphela ukuthetha ukuba uyazi ukuba ukubona iindawo ziza kukhula yaye ukubona ukuba umsebenzi usebenza njani uphantse njengoko silindele," uMateyu uthe.

en: The local consumer rights watchdog, the Consumers Association of Malawi, had been planning to hold vigils at the water board until the water supply was normalized, but the board asked protesters to hold off, promising to distribute water to residents through mobile water tanks.
xho: Iqumrhu elijongene namalungelo abathengi basekuhlaleni, iConsumers Association of Malawi, bebeceba ukubamba imilindelo kwibhodi yamanzi de kube yinto eqhelekileyo ukuhanjiswa kwamanzi, kodwa ibhodi yacela abaqhankqalazi ukuba bayeke, bethembisa ukuhambisa amanzi kubahlali ngokusebenzisa iitanki zamanzi ezihambayo.
mt0: U-Consumers Association of Malawi, i-Consumers Association of Malawi, ulungiselele ukubamba ii-vigils e-water board until supply was normalized, kodwa i-board icele ukuba abantu balinde, ithembise ukuba ii-water tanks ziza kunikezelwa abantu.

en: The consumer rights group has given the water board two weeks to fulfill its commitment before proceeding with the protests.
xho: Iqela lamalungelo abathengi linike ibhodi yamanzi iiveki ezimbini ukuba ifezekise isibophelelo sayo phambi kokuba iqhube noqhanqalazo.
mt0: Ukundiza umthetho unikezele i-water board iintsuku ezimbini ukuba igcwalise iinkcukacha zayo ngaphambi kokuqhubeka nokubhikisha.

en: Water Crisis Raises Fears of Waterborne Disease in Malawi

mt0: Uxolo lweNdalo Lwandisa iingozi zokugula ngesifo se-waterborne disease eMalawi

en: Malawians in the country's commercial capital, Blantyre, usually rely on tap water.
xho: Abantu baseMalawi abakwikomkhulu lezorhwebo lelizwe, iBlantyre, bakholisa ukuxhomekeka kumanzi aphuma empompo.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know Malawians in the country's commercial capital, Blantyre, usually rely on tap water.

en: But for the past five months, the taps have often run dry, forcing residents to draw water from unprotected sources like rivers and wells, while work is being done at the city main pumping station.
xho: Kodwa kwezi nyanga zintlanu zidlulileyo, iitepu bezisoloko zomile, nto leyo enyanzelise abahlali ukuba bakha amanzi kwimithombo engakhuselekanga efana nemilambo namaqula, logama kusetyenzwa kwisikhululo sokumpompa amanzi edolophini.
mt0: Uyakwazi ukuba ii-taps ziye zakhala iinyanga eziliqela, ngoko ke abantu bamele bathathe amanzi evela kwiindawo ezingakhuselekileyo njengeendlela kunye nee-wells, ngoko ke umsebenzi uqhubeka kwi-city main pumping station.

en: The risk of contracting water-borne diseases is rising.
xho: Umngcipheko wokufumana izifo ezibangelwa ngamanzi uyakhula.
mt0: Ukuba awukwazi ukuguqulela kuphela uthi awukwazi. Ukuba awukwazi ukuguqulela uthi awukwazi. Ukuba awukwazi ukuguqulela uthi awukwazi.

en: In Blantyre and surrounding areas, residents have spent five days without tap water.

mt0: In Blantyre and surrounding areas, residents have spent five days without tap water.

en: Malawi President Under Fire for Giving Money to Journalists
xho: Umongameli waseMalawi uphantsi komlilo ngokunika imali kwiintatheli
mt0: Please return only the translated translation. If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: Malawi President Peter Mutharika is under fire for giving envelopes containing $125 to more than 80 media people at a dinner he hosted last month in Blantyre.
xho: Umongameli waseMalawi uPeter Mutharika utyholwa ngokunika imvulophu equlethe i-125 yeedola kubantu beendaba abangaphezu kwe-80 kwisidlo ebesibambe kwinyanga ephelileyo eBlantyre.
mt0: Please return only the translated translation. Malawi President Peter Mutharika is under fire for giving envelopes containing $125 to more than 80 media people at a dinner he hosted last month in Blantyre.

en: The editor of the privately owned Times Television said reporters were told the envelopes contained the presidents plans for the media - which has been critical of the governments economic performance.
xho: Umhleli weTimes Television yabucala uthe abacholacholi baxelelwa ukuba iimvulophu zinezicwangciso zoomongameli kumajelo eendaba - nto leyo ibigxeka ukusebenza kukarhulumente kwezoqoqosho.
mt0: U-editor of the privately owned Times Television said reporters were told the envelopes contained the president's plans for the media - which has been critical of the government's economic performance.

en: In his column published in Malawis Sunday Times newspaper, editor Grecian Tukula said he was not sure why the money was given to journalists at the state dinner.
xho: Kwikholamu yakhe epapashwe kwiphephandaba laseMalawi iSunday Times, umhleli uGrecian Tukula uthe akaqinisekanga ngesizathu sokuba le mali inikwe iintatheli kwisidlo sikarhulumente.
mt0: In his column published in Malawi's Sunday Times newspaper, editor Grecian Tukula said he was not sure why the money was given to journalists at the state dinner.

en: Tukula said he initially decided to return the money but reversed the decision to avoid "creating a scene."
xho: UTukula uthi uqale wathatha isigqibo sokuyibuyisela le mali kodwa wasirhoxisa eso sigqibo ukuze aphephe “ukuzijongisa.”
mt0: U-Tukula uthe uthathe iinqwelo zokubuyisela imali kuqala kodwa wabuyela ekugqibeleni ukuze aphephe "ukudala iindawo."

en: But the editor for the Weekend Nation newspaper, George Kasakula, told VOA that he returned the money right away.
xho: Kodwa umhleli wephephandaba iWeekend Nation, uGeorge Kasakula, uxelele iVOA ukuba uyibuyise kwangoko le mali.
mt0: Uya kubuyela kuphela e-translated. Ukuba awukwazi ukuguqula uxolo, uGeorge Kasakula, umphathi wephephandaba le-Weekend Nation, uthe uthe wabuyisela imali ngokukhawuleza.

en: I just felt it was not right for me to receive the money, so I returned it.
xho: “Ndavakalelwa kukuba ayifanelekanga ukuba ndiyifumane loo mali, ngoko ndayibuyisela.
mt0: Return the translated sentence only. If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know I just felt it was not right for me to receive the money, so I returned it.

en: My understanding is that if someone invites me to a workshop, its their duty to ensure that they feed me, they accommodate me and they transport me.
xho: Ukuqonda kwam kukuba xa umntu endimema kwiworkshop, yindima yabo ukuqinisekisa ukuba uyandondla, uyandihlalisa kwaye uyandithutha.
mt0: Indlela ecacileyo ukuba ubani ukundibiza eworkshop, idutya labo ukuqinisekisa ukuba bamphe, bamlungiselele, bamhambise.

en: But in this case, I didnt see why I should get that allowance because I didnt spend anything to go to Sanjika [Palace]," said Kasakula.
xho: Kodwa kule meko, andizange ndibone ukuba kutheni ndifanele ndifumane eso sibonelelo kuba andizange ndachitha nto ukuya eSanjika,” utshilo uKasakula.
mt0: In this case, I didnt see why I should get that allowance because I didnt spend anything to go to Sanjika [Palace]," said Kasakula.

en: The issue has attracted more public attention after privately owned Capital Radio aired a story questioning the meaning of the cash handouts from the president.
xho: Lo mba utsale umdla woluntu emva kokuba inkampani yabucala yeCapital Radio yasasaza ibali elibuza ngentsingiselo yemali evela kumongameli.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know The issue has attracted more public attention after a privately owned Capital Radio aired a story questioning the meaning of the cash handouts from the president.

en: As Capital FM we serve the interest of the public.
xho: “SiyiCapital FM sisebenzela uluntu.
mt0: Return only the translated translation. If you cannot translate simply say you don't know As Capital FM we serve the interest of the public.

en: This issue has been all over the social media, and even we as a media are implicated [we believe] it is paramount that we follow up and get to the bottom of the matter," said Steven Dakalira, the head of news and current affairs at Capital Radio.
xho: Lo mcimbi ubugcwele kumakhasi onxibelelwano, kwaye nathi njengamajelo eendaba siyachaphazeleka “sikholelwa ukuba kubaluleke kakhulu ukuba siwulandele kwaye sifikelele ezantsi kulo mba,” utshilo uSteven Dakalira, intloko yeendaba nemicimbi yangoku. kwiCapital Radio.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know This issue has been all over the social media, and even we as a media are implicated [we believe] it is paramount that we follow up and get to the bottom of the matter," said Steven Dakalira, the head of news and current affairs at Capital Radio.

en: In his column in the Nyasa Times, Malawi professor of law Danwood Mzikenge Chirwa said what President Mutharika did by giving money handouts to journalists at a news event was tantamount to bribery. He has called on Mutharika to resign or face impeachment proceedings.
xho: Kwikholamu yakhe kwiNyasa Times, unjingalwazi wezomthetho eMalawi uDanwood Mzikenge Chirwa uthe into eyenziwa nguMongameli Mutharika ngokunika iintatheli imali kumsitho weendaba kufana nokunyoba. Ucele uMutharika ukuba arhoxe okanye ajongane nenkqubo yokubeka ityala.
mt0: In his column in the Nyasa Times, Malawi professor of law Danwood Mzikenge Chirwa said what President Mutharika did by giving money handouts to journalists at a news event was tantamount to bribery. He has called on Mutharika to resign or face impeachment proceedings.

en: Local civil society groups said that "by attempting to bribe the journalists" Mutharika subjected his leadership style to disrepute.

en: Report: Manufacturing Could Free Poorest Nations From Poverty.

en: A new United Nations report urges the poorest countries in the world to shift from low- to high-productivity activities to improve their economies.
xho: Ingxelo entsha yeZizwe eziManyeneyo ikhuthaza amazwe ahlwempuzekileyo emhlabeni ukuba atshintshe ukusuka kwizinto eziphantsi ukuya kwimveliso ephezulu ukuphucula uqoqosho lwawo.

en: In its annual Least Developed Countries Report, UNCTAD — the U.N. Conference on Trade and Development — says these countries must structurally transform their economies to free themselves from the "poverty trap," which is stunting economic growth and development.

mt0: In its annual Least Developed Countries Report, UNCTAD — the U.N. Conference on Trade and Development — says these countries must structurally transform their economies to free themselves from the "poverty trap," which is stunting economic growth and development.

en: Of the 48 nations the U.N. considers "Least Developed Countries" (LDCs), only one, Laos, is on track to achieve all seven of the Millennium Development Goals (MDG's) by 2015.

en: The so-called Sustainable Development Goals, which carry on from where the MDGs leave off, call for eradication of poverty by 2030.

en: In order for the least developed countries to achieve this miraculous performance, he says they will need to structurally change their economies.

en: We think that is the case because these countries have not focused efficiently on building what we call their productive capacities, Davis said.

en: Strike Paralyzes Malawi's Judicial Services

en: A week-long strike by the support staff of Malawi's judiciary system has paralyzed the courts, causing overcrowding in police cells and the indefinite suspension of major cases - including government corruption trials.
xho: Uqhankqalazo oluthathe iveki yonke lwabasebenzi bokuxhasa inkqubo yenkundla yaseMalawi liqhwalelise iinkundla, nto leyo ebangele ukuxinana kwizisele zamapolisa kunye nokunqunyanyiswa kwamatyala amakhulu - kuqukwa namatyala urhwaphilizo kurhulumente.
mt0: A week-long strike by support staff of Malawi's judiciary system has paralyzed the courts, causing overcrowding in police cells and the indefinite suspension of major cases - including government corruption trials.

en: Court marshals, clerks and messengers are demanding the 30 percent salary increases promised by the government two years ago.
xho: Iimashali zenkundla, oonobhala kunye nabathunywa bafuna ukonyuselwa imivuzo ngamashumi amathathu eepesenti ekhulwini ababethenjiswe ngurhulumente kwiminyaka emibini edlulileyo.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: Chanting and singing around the court premises has become a pastime activity for the striking court workers since the onset of a sit-in last week.
xho: Ukuxhentsa nokucula kwindawo yenkundla ibe ngumsebenzi wokuzonwabisa kubasebenzi benkundla ababegwayimbile ukusukela oko kuqale ukuhlaliswa kwabantu kwiveki ephelileyo.
mt0: Singing and singing around the court premises has become a pastime activity for the striking court workers since the start of a sit-in last week.

en: Linley Hebert, a spokesperson for the striking workers, told VOA the strike is a result of the governments failure to honor a 2012 agreement.
xho: ULinley Hebert, isithethi sabasebenzi abagwayimbileyo, uxelele iVOA ukuba olu qhankqalazo lubangelwa kukungaphumeleli koorhulumente ukuhlonipha isivumelwano sika2012.
mt0: ULinley Hebert, i-spokesman for the striking workers, uthe i-strike is a result of the government's failure to honor a 2012 agreement.

en: In October [this year], the government reviewed the salaries of the civil servants, but we were not included in that revision, Hebert said.
xho: “Ngenyanga kaOkuthowbha [kulo nyaka] urhulumente uye waphonononga imivuzo yabasebenzi bakarhulumente, kodwa asizange sibandakanywe kolo hlaziyo,” utshilo uHebert.
mt0: In October [this year], the government reviewed the salaries of the civil servants, but we were not included in that revision, Hebert said.

en: Yet in 2012, we had an agreement that each time they are revising the salaries of the civil servants, [they will be increasing our salaries as well].
xho: “Kodwa ngo-2012, saba nesivumelwano sokuba qho xa behlaziya imivuzo yabasebenzi bakarhulumente, [babe besonyusa imivuzo yethu].
mt0: In 2012, siye savumelana ukuba njalo xa beguqula ii-salary ze-civil servants, [baza kukhupha ii-salary zethu].

en: So, [after adhering to the agreement in 2013], we are surprised to see that this time we are left out."
xho: Ke, [emva kokubambelela kwisivumelwano ngo-2013], siyamangaliswa kukubona ukuba ngeli xesha sishiywe ngaphandle. "
mt0: Uyakwazi ukuba uyazi ukuba, [emva kokuthobela umthetho ngo-2013,] simangalisiwe ukuba kweli xesha sishiyeke."

mt0: Ufreeze uvela ekubeni i-government financial scandal apho i-$30 million ikhuphwe kwi-government coffers.

xho: Isithethi sesebe lezimali u-UN Msowoya uxelele isikhululo sikanomathotholo sasekuhlaleni ukuba kunzima kurhulumente ukuhlangabezana nemfuno yabasebenzi.

en: It is difficult to promise what the treasury will do. But suffice to say that the prevailing economic circumstances and budgetary constraints will make a little bit difficult for the treasury to bow down to the demands, "Msowoya said.
xho: “Kunzima ukuthembisa into eza kwenziwa ngunondyebo. Kodwa kwanele ukuthi imeko yezoqoqosho egqubayo kunye nokunqongophala kohlahlo lwabiwo-mali kuza kwenza kubenzima kancinci ukuba unondyebo athobele amabango,” utshilo uMsowoya.

en: The United Nations World Food Program says the famine in southern Africa is even worse than predicted.

en: WFP officials are warning that 13 million people in six countries: Malawi, Zambia, Lesotho, Zimbabwe, Swaziland and Mozambique are in danger of starvation if they do not get food aid.
xho: Amagosa eWFP alumkisa ngelithi abantu abazizigidi ezili-13 kumazwe amathandathu: iMalawi, iZambia, iLesotho, iZimbabwe, iSwaziland neMozambique basengozini yokulamba ukuba abalufumani uncedo lokutya.

en: World Food Program officials say they need one million tons of food to alleviate hunger in southern Africa, but they are not confident they will get it.

en: The organization, Eye of the Child, is expressing concern about what is says is a large number of children who are being forced to work due to poverty.
xho: Umbutho, i-Eye of the Child, uvakalisa inkxalabo ngento ekuthiwa luninzi lwabantwana abanyanzelwa ukuba baphangele ngenxa yendlala.

en: It says these children risk being abused.

mt0: Uya kuthetha ukuba abanye abantwana banokuthi baphathwe kakubi.

en: Some under aged children work as mini – bus call boys in the busy business district of Limbe in the commercial capital, Blantyre.
xho: Abanye abantwana abangaphantsi kweminyaka yobudala basebenza njengabakhwazi kwiibhasi ezincinci kwindawo yoshishino exakekileyo eLimbe kwikomkhulu lezorhwebo, iBlantyre.
mt0: Uyakwazi ukuba abanye abantwana abancinci basebenza njengemini-bus call boys in the busy business district of Limbe in the commercial capital, Blantyre.

en: They are some of the many children who have been forced into employment because of poverty.
xho: Bangabanye babantwana abaninzi abaye banyanzeleka ukuba baphangele ngenxa yokusokola.
mt0: Uyakwazi ukuba ziziphi iintombi ezininzi eziye zaxhomekeka ekubeni zizilwanyana ezine eziye zaxhomekeka ekubeni zizilwanyana ezine.

en: Maxwell Matewere is the executive director of Eye of the Child. He says many of the children come from rural areas.
xho: UMaxwell Matewere ngumlawuli olawulayo kwi-Eye of the Child. Uthi uninzi lwabantwana luphuma ezilalini.
mt0: Maxwell Matewere nguMlawuli weEye of the Child. Uthi abantwana abaninzi bakho bavela kumazwe amahlathi.

en: He says, "Currently we havent done a data analysis but the Ministry of Labor intends to do that as soon as possible with financial resources from the International Labor Organization.
xho: Uthi, "Okwangoku asikenzi uhlalutyo lwedatha kodwa uMphathiswa wezaBasebenzi uzimisele ukwenza oko ngokukhawuleza ngemithombo yemali evela kwiInternational Labor Organization.
mt0: Uthi, "Nangona akukho ucwaningo lwedatha okwamanje, i-Ministry of Labor intends to do that as soon as possible with financial resources from the International Labor Organization.

en: But basing on our own assessment and through our works, we feel child labor is a serious problem particularly in the rural areas and you can tell that from trafficking of children from rural areas to urban areas where most of the young people are working in peoples houses.
xho: Kodwa ngokusekwe kuvavanyo lwethu nangemisebenzi yethu, sivakalelwa kukuba ukuqeshwa kwabantwana kuyingxaki enkulu ngakumbi kwiindawo ezisemaphandleni kwaye unokuxela ukuba ukusuka ekurhwebeni kwabantwana besuka ezilalini besiya ezidolophini apho uninzi lolutsha lusebenza kwizindlu zabantu. .
mt0: Uyakwazi ukuba umsebenzi ubaluleke kakhulu emazweni onke, kodwa ngokusekelwe ekuhlolweni kwethu kunye neenkonzo zethu, sicinga ukuba umsebenzi owenziwa ngumsebenzi obaluleke kakhulu, ikakhulukazi emazweni ahlala kuwo onke amaxesha e- rural areas.

en: Mr. Matewere says poor children often find work on large farm estates.
xho: UMnu. Matewere uthi abantwana abangathathi ntweni bahlala befumana umsebenzi kumafama amakhulu.
mt0: UMatewere uthi abantwana abancinci bahlala befumana umsebenzi kwiindawo ezinkulu zokulima.

en: He said, "We have noticed that there are some indications that there are children who are working in tea estates and tobacco estates.
xho: Uthe, “Siqaphele ukuba kukho izinto ezibonisa ukuba kukho abantwana abasebenza kwiindawo zeti necuba.
mt0: Uthe, "Sibonile ukuba kukho iingxelo ukuba kukho abantwana abasebenza kwiindawo zokuvelisa ii-tea kunye neendawo zokuvelisa ii-tobacco.

en: There also are children who are working in brick making mostly their parents will facilitate for them to work in those kinds of employment. "
xho: Kukwakho abantwana abasebenza ekwenzeni izitena ubukhulu becala abazali babo baya kubaququzelela ukuba basebenze kwezo ntlobo zengqesho. "
mt0: Uyakwazi ukuba kukho abantu abantwana abasebenza ekwakheni iibricks, yaye abantu abaninzi bazokwenza ukuba bakwazi ukusebenza ezo nkonzo.

en: Mr. Matewere says the Eye of the Child has established that there are gross violations of children rights in the country.
xho: Umnu. Matewere uthi iEye of the Child ifumanise ukuba kukho ukunyhashwa kwamalungelo abantwana kweli lizwe.
mt0: Mr. Matewere says the Eye of the Child has established that there are gross violations of children's rights in the country.

en: These include, rape, defilement and being overworked.
xho: Oku kubandakanya, udlwengulo, ukungcola kunye nokusebenza ngokugqithisileyo.
mt0: Oku kubandakanya, ukubulawa, ukufa, kunye nokusebenza ngokweqile.

en: He says this violates the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child.
xho: Uthi oku kunyhasha iNkomfa yeZizwe eziManyeneyo ngamaLungelo oMntwana.
mt0: Uthi oku kumele kwenzeke kuphela ukuba ukwazi. Ukuba awukwazi ukuthetha ngoko, uthi awukwazi.

en: If you look at the Convention of the Rights of a Child, he said, "you will see that it provides for the protection for children from any kind of exploitation from any kind of harmful activities or act which threatens their health, their development which is a threat to education.
xho: Ukuba ujonga kwiNgqungquthela yamaLungelo oMntwana, watsho, "uya kubona ukuba ibonelela ngokhuseleko lwabantwana kulo naluphi na uhlobo lokuxhaphaza kulo naluphi na uhlobo lwemisebenzi eyingozi okanye isenzo esisongela impilo yabo, ukukhula kwabo. nto leyo esisisongelo kwimfundo.
mt0: If you look at the Convention of the Rights of a Child, he said, "you will see that it provides for the protection for children from any kind of exploitation from any kind of harmful activities or act which threatens their health, their development which is a threat to education.

en: So children who are found working in tea estates, who are found in brick making, obvious, their rights as it is provided for in the Convention for the Rights of the Children as well as in the constitution are violated. "
xho: Ngoko ke abantwana abafunyanwa besebenza kwiindawo zeti, abafunyanwa ekwenzeni izitena, kucacile, amalungelo abo njengoko ebonelelwe kwiNgqungquthela yamaLungelo abaNtwana ngokunjalo nakumgaqo-siseko bayagxojwa. "
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know. So children who are found working in tea estates, who are found in brick making, obvious, their rights as it is provided for in the Convention for the Rights of the Children as well as in the constitution are violated.

en: The Eye of the Child executive director says his organization is looking at ways of protecting the rights of a child.

en: Enticement  Court documents show that Masambuka was enticed by his brother to meet his friends, who he claimed had found a girl for him to marry.

en: But when they reached the scene, the alleged friends grabbed Masambuka by the neck and dragged him to a garden where they killed him. Here, his assailants cut off his limbs, burned his body using petrol and buried it there.

en: Zimbabwe Official Defends Crackdown on Protests, Urges Patience with Economy
xho: Igosa laseZimbabwe likhusela uqhanqalazo, libongoza umonde kuQoqosho
mt0: Zimbabwe Official Defends Crackdown on Protests, Urges Patience with Economy

en: Zimbabwe's minister of foreign affairs and international trade on Monday defended crackdowns on anti-government demonstrations and urged patience in turning around the country's foundering economy.
xho: Umphathiswa wemicimbi yangaphandle kunye norhwebo lwamazwe ngamazwe eZimbabwe ngoMvulo ukhusele uqhanqalazo oluchasene norhulumente kwaye wabongoza ukuba nomonde ekuguquleni uqoqosho olusekiyo.
mt0: Zimbabwe's minister of foreign affairs and international trade on Monday defended crackdowns on anti-government protests and urged patience in turning around the country's foundering economy.

en: Though "everybody's got the right to demonstrate," there have "been a lot of insinuations and campaigns of violence,"
xho: Nangona "wonke umntu enelungelo lokubonisa," kuye kwakho "iintetho ezininzi kunye namaphulo obundlobongela,"
mt0: Although "everybody has the right to demonstrate," there have been "a lot of insinuations and campaigns of violence," says a spokesman.

en: Sibusiso B. Moyo told VOA in an interview.
xho: USibusiso B. Moyo uxelele iVOA kudliwano-ndlebe.
mt0: Return only translation. If you cannot translate simply say you don't know Sibusiso B. Moyo told VOA in an interview.

en: Citing public safety, he endorsed a Zimbabwe court's ruling hours earlier to uphold a police ban on a protest organized by the opposition Movement for Democratic Change (MDC) alliance.
xho: Ecaphula ukhuseleko loluntu, uye wavumelana nesigqibo senkundla yaseZimbabwe kwiiyure ezingaphambili zokuxhasa ukuvalwa umlomo kwamapolisa kuqhanqalazo olwaluququzelelwa ngumbutho ophikisayo weMovement for Democratic Change (MDC).
mt0: Uthe ukhathazeke ngempilo yomphakathi, uqinisekise ukuba iZimbabwe court iqinisekise ukuba ipolisa ikhuphe i-ban on a protest organized by the opposition Movement for Democratic Change (MDC) alliance.

en: Alliance leaders are pressing President Emmerson Mnangagwa and the ruling ZANU-PF party for a role in a transitional government.
xho: Iinkokheli zomanyano zinyanzelisa uMongameli Emmerson Mnangagwa kunye neqela elilawulayo leZANU-PF ukuba bathathe inxaxheba kurhulumente wenguqu.
mt0: Alliance leaders are pressing President Emmerson Mnangagwa and the ruling ZANU-PF party for a role in a transitional government.

en: They had organized a demonstration Monday in Bulawayo, the country's second-largest city, but police authorities banned it hours before its intended start.
xho: Bebeququzelele uqhanqalazo ngoMvulo koBulawayo, isixeko sesibini ngobukhulu kweli lizwe, kodwa amapolisa aluvala kwiiyure ezimbalwa phambi kokuba luqale.
mt0: Uyalelwe ukubamba i-demonstration ngoMvulo eBulawayo, ikomkhulu lesibini eZimbabwe, kodwa iipolisa zazibhengeza i-demonstration iintsuku eziliqela ngaphambi kokuba iqale.

en: Two other opposition demonstrations still are planned this week: for the central city of Gweru on Tuesday and the southeastern city of Masvingo on Wednesday.
xho: Eminye imiqhankqalazo emibini yenkcaso isacwangcisiwe kule veki: kumbindi wesixeko saseGweru ngoLwesibini nakwisixeko esikumazantsi mpuma eMasvingo ngolwesithathu.
mt0: Uyakwazi ukuba kukho ii-demonstrations ezimbini ezilindeleke ukuba zibanjwa kweli xesha: for the central city of Gweru on Tuesday and the southeastern city of Masvingo on Wednesday.

en: Police also had pre-emptively banned a demonstration in Harare last Friday, a decision upheld by a Zimbabwe court.
xho: Amapolisa nawo aye aluvala kwangaphambili uqhanqalazo eHarare ngoLwesihlanu odlulileyo, isigqibo esixhaswe yinkundla yaseZimbabwe.
mt0: Uyakwazi ukuba uyazi ukuba ipolisa nayo ikhuphe i-demonstration eHarare ngoLwesihlanu, i-judge eZimbabwe iqinisekisile.

en: Hundreds of MDC supporters ignored the ban, leading to clashes between civilians and police.
xho: Amakhulu-khulu abalandeli be-MDC akasihoyanga esi sithintelo, nto leyo ekhokelele kungquzulwano phakathi kwabahlali namapolisa.
mt0: Hundreds of MDC supporters ignored the ban, leading to clashes between civilians and police.

en: Video and photographs showed police hitting and kicking some demonstrators among actions that drew complaints of excessive force from civil and human rights groups, including the United Nations human rights office.
xho: Ividiyo kunye neefoto zibonise amapolisa ebetha kwaye ekhaba abanye abaqhankqalazi phakathi kwezenzo eziye zazisa izikhalazo zamandla agqithisileyo kumaqela oluntu kunye namalungelo oluntu, kuquka ne-ofisi yamalungelo oluntu yeZizwe eziManyeneyo.
mt0: Video and photos showed police hitting and kicking some demonstrators among actions that drew complaints of excessive force from civil and human rights groups, including the United Nations human rights office.

en: Police, not demonstrators, showed up in force on Bulawayo streets Monday, with foot patrols wielding shields, batons and, in some cases, pistols.
xho: Amapolisa, hayi abaqhankqalazi, athe agaleleka kwizitalato zakwaBulawayo ngoMvulo, ephethe amakhaka, amakhuni, kwezinye iimeko, imipu.

mt0: Gasoline costs climbed, too. In Harare, the per-liter price climbed from $1.41 to $1.69 from Tuesday to Wednesday.

en: The surge in food prices was the biggest driver behind consumer inflation in Egypt, it rose by 8.8% in February – the sharpest increase in nearly three years, according to the state statistics agency, CAPMAS.
xho: Ukunyuka kwamaxabiso okutya kwaba ngoyena mqhubi mkhulu wokunyuka kwamaxabiso e-Egypt, anyuke nge-8.8% ngoFebruwari – okona kunyuka kuphezulu phantse kwiminyaka emithathu, ngokutsho kwe-arhente karhulumente yezibalo, iCAPMAS.
mt0: Ukhuphiswano lweempahla ezazisiweyo yenye yezizathu eziphambili zokukhuphisana kwexabiso lokudla e-Egypt, ekhuphiseke nge-8.8% ngoFebruwari – i-sharpest increase in nearly three years, according to the state statistics agency, CAPMAS.

en: Cudjoe said it was crucial for governments and regional bodies such as the African Union to build defenses to cushion consumers in times of economic uncertainty.
xho: UCudjoe uthe kubalulekile ukuba oorhulumente kunye namaqumrhu engingqi anje ngeManyano yase-Afrika bakhe ukhuselo lokukhusela abathengi ngamaxesha okungaqiniseki kwezoqoqosho.
mt0: U-Cudjoe uthi kwakubaluleke ukuba iinkundla kunye neenhlangano ezifana ne-African Union zibambe iindlela zokukhusela abantu emaqenjini e-economic uncertainty.

en: Even if it means building defenses in terms of the provision of food, said Cudjoe, adding, "I could imagine Nigeria, if it had had its way, it could be selling foodstuff to most countries at reduced rates by now."
xho: Nokuba oko kuthetha ukwakha ukhuseleko malunga nokubonelela ngokutya, utshilo uCudjoe, esongeza, "Ndiyayicingela iNigeria, ukuba yayinendlela yayo, inokuthengisa ukutya kumazwe amaninzi ngexabiso elithotyiweyo ngoku."
mt0: "Even if it means building defenses in terms of the provision of food, said Cudjoe, adding, "I could imagine Nigeria, if it had its way, it could be selling foodstuff to most countries at reduced rates by now."

en: There must be that urgency of building for themselves defenses, funds that would make us sustain ourselves -- at least to prevent us from being completely annihilated by these uncertainties in the world.
xho: Kunokuba khukho ukungxamiseka kokuzakhela ukhuseleko ngokunokwabo, iimali ebezinokusenza ukuba sizigcine-- noko ukusithintela ekutshatyalalisweni ngokupheleleyo koku kungaqiniseki emhlabeni.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know There must be that urgency of building for themselves defenses, funds that would make us sustain ourselves -- at least prevent us from being completely annihilated by these uncertainties in the world.

en: Chibamba Kanyama, an economist in the Zambian capital of Lusaka, said suspending fuel taxes would be "the most ideal thing to do now under the circumstances" to cushion consumers and industries.
xho: UChibamba Kanyama, ingcali yezoqoqosho kwikomkhulu laseZambia eLusaka, uthe ukunqumamisa irhafu yamafutha kuya kuba "yeyona nto ilungileyo ukuyenza ngoku phantsi kwelemeko" ukuxhasa abathengi kunye namashishini.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know. Chibamba Kanyama, an economist in the Zambian capital of Lusaka, said suspending fuel taxes would be "the most ideal thing to do now under the circumstances" to cushion consumers and industries.

en: African governments must find a way of responding," he said.
xho: “Oorhulumente baseAfrika kufuneka bafumane indlela yokusabela,” utshilo.
mt0: Uya kubuyela kuphela ekuguquleleni. Ukuba awukwazi ukuguqulela uthi uyazi ukuba amazwe aseAfrika afanele afumane indlela yokuphendula," uthe.

en: It is a choice of whether to reduce taxes to lower the prices or to maintain the price levels and use the revenues to subsidize the most vulnerable in society."
xho: Kufuneka kukhetwe phakathi kuncitshiswa irhafu ukuthoba amaxabiso okanye ukugcina amaxabiso aphantsi kunye nokusebenzisa ingeniso ukuxhasa abona bantu basesichengeni kuluntu."

en: But Kanyama also suggested that the geopolitical crisis involving Russia and Ukraine – both big grain exporters to Africa – may create opportunities for African producers.
xho: Kodwa uKanyama ukwacebise ukuba ingxaki yezelizwe kunye nezopolitiko ebandakanya iRussia ne-Ukraine - omabini amazwe angabathengisi abakhulu bokutya okuziinkozo e-Afrika - ingadala amathuba kubavelisi baseAfrika.
mt0: Kodwa uKanyama uphakamise ukuba ingozi egeopolitiki phakathi kweRussia neUkraine – zombini ii-grain exporters to Africa – iyenza ithuba kubavelisi baseAfrika.

en: Supply countries like South Africa, with robust and highly mechanized systems, may find a window of exporting [commodities]
xho: “Amazwe abonelela ngeenkonzo afana noMzantsi Afrika, aneenkqubo ezomeleleyo noomatshini abaphezulu, anokufumana ifestile yokuthumela ngaphandle [impahla]
mt0: Uyakwazi ukuba iindawo zokuvelisa njengeSouth Africa, ezineendlela eziqinileyo kunye neendlela ezisebenzayo, zingafumana ithuba lokuthengisa [iicommodities]

en: like wheat and other products to fill the gaps left by Russia and Ukraine," Kanyama said.

mt0: Return only translation. If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know like wheat and other products to fill the gaps left by Russia and Ukraine," Kanyama said.
